description: Just wanted an easy vm app without the hassle of virtualbox and this delivers. I'm not a techy so I'm sure it's lacking for advanced users looking for more, but for a casual user this is just what I was looking for. Installing from the software center wouldn't start any vm's, so I tried uninstalling and installing via command line and suddenly my vm's worked.
nothing work... only other linux os.. useless at all.
Need ability to create a ChromeOS VM (.bin)
It's really good for basics, but it lacks basic features needed for a productive or professional environment such as ability to switch between a bridged and NAT connection etc...
By far the easiest way to create quick and dirty VMs.
Does have bugs when reconnecting to local VNC or SSH session.
Best virtualization app that i ever tried, much better than virtualbox

That's very bad !
Love that I can run VMs on my Steam Deck. Wish there was USB device support so I could plug in a PKI card reader, but think that is more a Valve issue than a Boxes issue so still giving 5 stars!

OTB there's no option to a Bridged connection.
That means, your VM are not accessible from other computers from the network.
You can try to customize your adapter to get the bridged mode... but you'll waiste a ridiculous amount of time. While you make your research you'll end finding the author against this options and pushing changes continuously to break any workaround better than help or implement this feature. 
Shameful !!
This is my favorite VM for any distro. Works better and easier to setup than other software.
Works perfectly and delivers what it promises.
Very easy to use!.
The only problem is that i can't get windows to run
I tried to use my MS DOS 6.22 image files but it did not accept them.

Snap version didn't work for me just like for many other users.

I finally figured out why. I had to manually turn on some permissions in Settings -> Applications -> Boxes (if you use Ubuntu). I enabled all of them, probably not all are needed.

The app should be preconfigured at least to have a permission to access KVM...
I tried installed windows 10 on it seriously I waited more than a whole HOUR, and no result. it's still "Installing" is this some kind of joke
best ever i see
Very clean and easy to use interface for QEMU. All it needs is "advanced" settings for machines
summary: Useful, but needs some more stuff

description:
It's by far the best virtual machine software I've ever tried; certainly much nicer than VirtualBox, it handles everything reliably out of the box, without any heap of configuration option. You can redirect USB devices to guests, or run guests in the background after closing Boxes. It also handles remote desktop protocols, notably VNC. The only real downside is that there are more user interface bugs than I would expect to see, but none that seriously affect operation of guests.

As a tip, if you're virtualizing a Linux OS, install the package 'spice-vdagent' in the guest to enable guest extensions.
Boxes is the most simple and enjoyable application to manage virtual machines.
Quite good simple Gnome VM app but could do with some more control over your Virtual Machines.
Could you mention the name of the executable under details, please?
summary: What is the name of the executable?

description: I had to virtualize an operating system to make a virtual network. Thanks to this application I could make it without touching critic conf files of my machine.

A simple application to easily manage virtual machine with minimal fuss. Its ability to import Virtual Box files is a welcome feature while the remote connection could be better should it be a potential replacement of similar application.
It works great, very easy to use.

I've used Virtualbox for a number of years though I've never really appreciated the red-tape associated with it (or on rare occasions, issues related to updating the host-OS kernel and having incompatible Virtualbox kernel modules...). I've only used this program for an hour or so at this point but, I am honestly impressed. This virtual machine manager does not provide much in the way of configuration for the systems however, what it gains instead is simplicity of usage.

Since I am only planning to use the associated virtual machines to do packaging for other sorts of Linux distributions, this program should be more than satisfactory.
Zero customization options and automatically deletes boxes for no reason

In order to use this under an SELinux confined user, you'll need to set one of two booleans.  For staff_u, you'll need to turn on staff_use_svirt.  For user_u and guest_u/xguest_u, turn on unprivuser_use_svirt.
This is the best app ever for creating virtual boxes. So easy, I love it.
It was working fine before upgrading to Fedora 26. Now I get an error when launching. I tried reinstalling but it's not working.
It doesn't even allow to resize the VM disk.
Really easy to use, but why created VMs sooner or later cannot be accessed? No changes done to VMs at all. Tried 6 different VMs created.
summary: Great idea, but either buggy or not intuitive

description: With GNOME Boxes, automatic resolution scaling, copy paste (from guest to host and vice versa), seamless switching between guest and host, and other advanced features seem to work automatically out of the box. While libvirt-manager has more fine-grained controls, it required more work to get basic features working. For example, I had to install spice-vdagent for seamless switching and copy-paste support. virt-manager also doesn't automatically rescale the resolution when manipulating the size of the window.
summary: Easy to setup, easier to use than virt-manager

description: Locks up a lot, mouse sync breaks, mouse is invisible, boggy, etc..
The only thing missing is a shared folder.

It worked beautifully, until I attempted to disable the nouveau graphics driver and replace with nvidia propriaty drivers. That is Centos 7.
Apart from that, it is very simple, straightforward. It allows you to get a VM up and running in minutes (without having to configure stuff).

Very simple. I understand the ethos of making it simple as possible, but some incredibly simple options could do with added like CPU allocation, or being able to change where virtual machines are stored.

I don't think simple options like that would break the simple ethos.
I needed a basic visualization option for installing multiple Linux OS's and this software handled everything very well. I did not face any issues or bugs till now.

+Clipboard works between Debian host and Windows
+You place it in a new workspace and it is just like any other application, you move your mouse and interact with the host operating system

-For me, even though it works out of the box and aims for simplicity, I would prefer to have some more options
-There are some bugs that need to be addressed in the interface
Has almost no settings and doesnt work with most things.
I use rdp:// crash
summary: great app, but not completely stable

description:
First of all, the main repository version (debian testing on mine) works right up to the point i install a new os. The live environment works fine (except for Manjaro for some reason). But the issue appears after the install. When i reboot the display just doesn't show the os booting up and coming to the login screen, even when i can clearly see it in the preview/thumbnail. So can't use it if i can't see what im doing.
So i installed the flathub version and the first thing i noticed is that my external drives where i usually keep my isos wasn't even visible (Not to mention that it displayed the wrong size estimate of my root file system).
And even otherwise it has the same issues as before.
With these little things fixed it would definitely be a 5 star app
i love the integration between fedora and fedora the option of having an express install is awsome saves me alot of time
Keep Killing It!!
Allows to download out of the box OS.
hello this is awesome alternative for virtualbox and etc.
simple and smooth

Great to have a single product with all these connection methods 

It lacks 
- SSH declaring of username so will pass your logon name everytime
- RDP crashes ALOT 
- VNC could do with a view only button 

otherwise it is a great tool one for any sysadmin

The GUI is very pleasing along with the functionality.
When I fist launched the application the greeting was awesome.

How ever I was not told to do these 3 things to make the application work "out of the box".

My problem "out of the box" was I could not boot a VM. I would get "failed to boot VM

My fix for this was to $ sudo adduser youusernamehere kvm , $ sudo apt install virt-manager , and restart the system.

My recommendation to the Developers would be a message displayed telling the user what is required. As in telling them to sudo adduser youusernamehere kvm , sudo apt install virt-manager , and restart.

Overall after fixing the problem the application works great. I also hopes this help anyone else with a similar problem. Have a nice day.
summary: Very good, but needs improvement! Error fix also + solution!

description: If you try to use Gnome Boxes in Ubuntu 18.04, you will have to do some additional steps and also install the spice tools. Once you do that, it works great for me. But I tried following the instructions on how to access a USB shown on the Gnome website, but it did not work. Creating a shared folder to access a USB drive in the VM did work for me. Now I have all that set up, it seems to do everything I need. The one thing that is kind of annoying is that I can't find a way to decrease the size of the reserved hard drive below that which was initially set up. I understand that you can install virt-manager to do more complicated manual changes, and there are instructions for this online. But as it is,... I am finding that I am confident enough in Gnome Boxes to have all my very expensive software (e.g. Matlab and ENVI) installed in the virtual machine, with the confidence that it will not just up and vanish.

It says in description that you can put any operating system and use them in the application. But it isn't even that. It even shows that in the screenshot Windows 10 can be put in the app. But it actually can't. I've installed the .iso file for Windows 10 and put it, but it just shows a plain black screen in front of me and then some green lines. I then switched the file to .tar, .zip, but it was the same thing. When I put the .exe file, it said I need to enable visualization, which it didn't say when I put Fedora Workstation. So I reboot my PC and went to BIOS setup, and I enabled visualization. But when I tried to open it after that it wouldn't even show up. I uninstalled and installed again five times but the same thing. It wasn't even good when it DID work. You can't select the size of the hard disk size of the VM you want to create. And maybe consider putting a larger variety of operating systems to choose.
I tried virtualizing Windows 8.1 Enterprise. Succesfully installed but when I reboot, I never see the home page, just never-eding spinning dots.
summary: Simple and beautiful design can be UNSTABLE

description:

Einfach zu bedienender VM Manager. Leider funktioniert er nicht. Gleich der erste Versuch mit FreeDOS geht in die Hose. Es bootet, ich starte die Installation, richte mit fdisk die virtuelle Platte ein - Reboot.

Es folgt die lapidare Meldung dass die laufende Box "FreeDOS" gelöscht wurde. Tja, vielen Dank dafür. Allerdings wollte ich das gar nicht ;)

description: Ich liebe diese Anwendung, für Anfänger die perfekte Lösung!

Ansich ein gutes und unkompliziertes Tool für die Verwaltung von VMs und Remote-Verbindungen, jedoch leider etwas zu stark vereinfacht für Nutzer mit mittleren technischen Ansprüchen. So kann bei RDP-Verbindungen z.B. weder die Übertragungsqualität noch scheinbar die Auflösung (wie z.B. Anpassung an die lokale Fenstergröße) geändert werden und die Standardaufösung ist viel zu popelig um über RDP auch nur ansatzweise brauchbar arbeiten zu können. Dies würde ich jetzt nicht unbedingt als "Experteneinstellungen" bezeichnen, weshalb es mich wundert weshalb es hierfür keine Einstellungsmöglichkeiten gibt. Schade.
Bei VMs vermisste ich die Möglichkeit ein physikalisches Laufwerk (Partition, USB 3 Festplatte o.ä.) als HDD für die VM verwenden zu können.
ISO booten und installieren in 2-3 Klicks, wenige Einstellungen aber das wichtigste ist da und funktioniert gut (Gerätefreigabe usw.)
leider stürzt es jetzt immer ab... hatte den fehler begannen ein betriebs system zu starten das noch nicht ganz gedowloaded war und jetzt stüzt das programm nur noch ab auch nach erneuten download

So einfach habe ich noch nie ein weiteres Betriebssystem innerhalb von Debian zum Laufen gebracht. Schön gemacht.

Hat nur wenige, dafür sinnvolle Einstellungen. Für mich die bessere Alternative zur unfreien Virtualbox.
Super für Linux Neulinge, welche von den vielen Optionen von VirtMananger abgeschreckt sind! Ich persönlich mag aber VirtManager lieber, da ich gern was anpasse...
I'm using wayland this may be the reason.

Stürzt permanent ab , egal ob bei rdp oder vm.
schade denn so eine einfache gui hatt schon was!

Es funktioniert wirklich gut, doch fehlt mir die Funktion, meine VMs auf einer externen SSD abzuspeichern, um meinen Internen Speicher nicht damit zu füllen...
eine stabile vm software
Musik aufs iPhone packen will und bracuht windows. Schnell, einfach, zuverlässig. Den Jungs lasse ich nich Geld zukommen.

Stark vereinfachte Vm. Wer öfter vm verwendet, wird wohl lieber VirtualBox oder VMWare oder......verwenden. Hardware verbinden, USB, Bldshrm aufzeichnen und andere annehmlicher schnikschnak fehlt. Daher schnell, unkompliziert,stabil.ISO liste ist natürlich zu kurz.

This is so simple, clear, just a few clicks needed to install a VM, works "out of the box" (haha, forgive the pun)
This must be the most simple and straightforward to use VM program available, much easier to use than Oracle Virtualbox or others.

just quick info, for sharing documents with the VM, install 
spice-webdav via 
sudo apt install spice-webdavd 
and you can drag and drop files from the host to the guest VM, Voila!

description: Nach jedem Start des Programms kommt "Ups das hätte nicht passieren dürfen" nach einem 2. Start läuft es dann - das Nervt mit der Zeit! Hier sehe ich erhebliches Verbesserungspotential!
Ich finde Boxen echt gut, nur bei mir stürzt es immer ab, wenn ich eine Box erstellen will. Aber sonst benutze ich es gerne (wenn es funktioniert).

Gracias a Dios! Por fin ALGO que se puede instalar y ejecutar completamente desde la comodidad de una interfaz grafica.
Yo la estoy corriendo bajo Kubuntu 20.04 con KDE+Plasma. (A pesar de estar orientada a GNOME, no presenta problemas). Estoy emulando Windows7 x64 con una chatarra de 1 core 2 threads 1.2Mhz + 4Gb. 
Teniendo en cuenta esto y restandole algun crasheo tras salir del modo "Sleep" aun se puede decir sin problema que es increible la estabilidad de la emulacion del OS guesped.
Desafortunadamente, parece que han dejado de brindarle soporte y algunas opciones como el "cut/paste" entre escritorios no es posible (...al menos yo no lo consegui).
Por otro lado, solo permite crear maquinas de unos 30Gb y la interfaz grafica es emulada bajo minimos. (Olvida eso de ejecutar ningun juego en 3D).

No obstante, para ejecutar "Visual Novels", visualzar imagenes, reproducir videos y navegar, la interfaz va muy fluida.

Tampoco tienes opciones avanzadas de configuracion (como por ejemplo Oracle VM si tiene).
clear linux ???
Es mejor usar la version gratuita de Oracle VirtualBox que es completa y mas util. Facil de instalar en Debian

Anteriormente escribí un comentario negativo sobre esta aplicación, pero me he informado y no es la aplicación, sino la tienda Snap la que falla. Descargué de la mencionada tienda y no me permitía instalar Windows, y cuando lo logré, no me reconocía USB. Al parecer fue fallo de mi parte pues no sabía que en la ventana de la máquina virtual existían tres puntos que son desplegables y es donde indican los dispositivos conectados.

Lamentablemente no indica, como en el anfitrión, de un dispositivo conectado y al no estar familiarizado con máquinas virtuales no supe qué hacer o dónde buscar.

Esta aplicación permite crear máquinas virtuales de una forma sencilla. Muy útil para usuarios que no se quieran complicar la vida.

La única pega que le encuentro es que da muy pocas opciones para personalizar la VM's. Entiendo el concepto de simplicidad, pero estaría bien tener la opción de ajustar parametros en un dialogo de "Opciones avanzadas"

Tiene muy pocos sistemas para bajar y el buscador solo muestra xp después de ser tecleado. (raro). Además se desconfigura el path de la fuente en imagenes live. Por lo demás bien pero peca de demasiado simple cuando hay problemas.

(C)
  sudo dnf install libvirt-daemon-config-network
  sudo systemctl enable virtnetworkd.service
Нормальное приложение но по функционалу намного хуже VBox к примеру нет режима моста для сетевой карты, что необходимо при изучении лабораторных работ и курсов.

Вообще, для просто запуска других операционок норм. Но вот нехватает функционала типа "общий буфер обмена" и других...
Ещё "общие папки" сложно настроить, хотелось бы, чтобы все из коробки работало, без установки на виртуалку пакетов space-webdavd и остальных

>> намного хуже VBox к примеру нет режима моста для сетевой карты

Есть. 
Ставь virt-manager, затем пиши в /etc/qemu/bridge.conf:

allow virbr0

И будет тебе мост.

>> Общий буфер обмена

Тоже есть. Внутрь ВМ ставь драйверы паравиртуализации и spice-gtk клиента.
